Authors: Shugoro Sakamoto, Keiichi Koda, Yutaka Tamai
Title:
Polycephalomyces lyristae sp. nov. (Clavicipitaceae), a new
species infecting cicada larva in japan, compared with Eniwa-semitake by
Shimizu
Keywords:
Cicadidae, Entomopathogenic fungi, Hypocreales,
Ophiocordycipitaceae, Taxonomy
Abstract:
We collected Pleurocordyceps species in Hokkaido, Japan,
and reported them with morphological and phylogenetic evidence. This
species differs morphologically from other species in the genus by
having a relatively thick, simple, columnar synnemata, a crustous mass
at the apex of the synnemata, and two types of conidia, globose to
subglobose and fusiform; phylogenetic analysis based on the ITS region
indicates that this is an undescribed species in the genus. A
morphological comparison of this species with specimens recorded, but
not described, in Hokkaido revealed that this species is
EniwaÂ–semitake.
